author: Josh Wingrove, Joe Deaux
description: President Donald Trump said he would be increasing tariffs on steel to 50% from 25%, saying the move would help protect American steelworkers during a visit to a United States Steel Corp. plant on Friday.
title: Trump to Raise Steel Tariffs to 50% to Help Nippon-US Steel Deal

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Clings to Good News While Risks Pile Up Fast

author: Zoe Tillman
description: As Elon Musk leaves his formal US government position, dozens of legal challenges over the billionaire’s powerful role in the Trump administration and the work of the Department of Government Efficiency will press ahead.
title: Elon Musk’s Court Fights to Outlast His Time in the White House

author: Laura Curtis
description: House Financial Services Chairman French Hill said activity by President Donald Trump in cryptocurrency and memecoins has complicated work in Congress to pass legislation that’s been in the works for years.
title: Trump Memecoins Complicate Legislative Effort, GOP Lawmaker Says

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Mayors in states that border Canada are calling for an end to President Donald Trump’s trade war with the country, saying it has harmed businesses and workers in their communities and upended one of the world’s most successful economic relationships.
title: Northern US Mayors Call for End to ‘Irrational’ Trade War With Canada

author: Ryan Beene, Dana Hull
description: Elon Musk said he will continue to advise President Donald Trump even after stepping away from the Department of Government Efficiency effort he has spearheaded.
title: Musk Pledges to Remain Trump Adviser After Washington Exit

author: Erik Larson
description: After a day of legal wrangling over his tariffs, President Donald Trump took to social media to attack the judges who ruled against him as well as a more surprising target: a powerful conservative legal group that helped shape his first-term judicial picks.
title: Trump Rails Against Tariff Judges, Conservative Legal Group

author: Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy plans to speak to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Friday, according to his daily video address.
title: Zelenskiy Plans to Discuss ‘Possible’ Monday Talks With Erdogan

author: Justin Sink
description: US President Donald Trump said he spoke to Emmanuel Macron after a viral video showed the French president being shoved in the face by his wife.
title: Trump Says Macron ‘Fine’ After Viral Shoving Incident With Wife

author: Michael Rapoport, Liz Capo McCormick, Emily Birnbaum
description: Congress’s own official tax scorekeeper is predicting a “revenge” tax buried in Donald Trump’s massive fiscal package would realize Wall Street’s fears and drive foreign investors away from US markets.
title: Trump ‘Revenge’ Tax Would Cut Foreign Investment, Congressional Panel Says

author: Anthony Capaccio, Courtney McBride
description: The top Democrat on the Senate Armed Services Committee slammed Pentagon plans to slash staffing at the office that oversees tests of major weapons systems, after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth claimed the cuts would save the government $300 million.
title: Democrats Slam Hegseth’s Plan to Cut Weapons-Testing Office

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: In courts across the US, migrants who arrive expecting a routine hearing are instead seeing judges dismiss their case and government agents waiting to arrest them.
title: Courthouse Arrests Stun Migrants Who Showed Up for Their Hearing

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio ramped up pressure on Harvard University on Friday with an order to focus even more scrutiny on the social-media profiles of any foreigner who seeks a visa to visit the school.
title: Rubio Orders Tougher Vetting for Any Foreign Visitor to Harvard

author: Kateryna Chursina, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: South Carolina Republican Lindsey Graham said the Senate is likely to “start moving” on new punishing sanctions against Russia next week because of the lack of progress toward a ceasefire in Ukraine.
title: Graham Expects Russia Sanctions Bill to ‘Start Moving’ Next Week

author: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard
description: The Trump administration plans to broaden restrictions on China’s tech sector with new regulations to capture subsidiaries of companies under US curbs.
title: US Plans Wider China Tech Sanctions With Subsidiary Crackdown

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: A key House Republican tax negotiator said he hopes the so-called “revenge” measure in President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill targeting foreign investors will be a deterrent that is never deployed.
title: Key Republican Hopes ‘Revenge’ Tax Will Be a Never-Used Deterrent

author: Akayla Gardner
description: Former US Education Secretary John King Jr. warned that President Donald Trump’s efforts to strip major research universities of federal funding could lead to a lasting regression in innovation and a loss of top talent.
title: Former Education Secretary Warns of Innovation ‘Disaster’ Amid Higher Ed Attacks

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: For months, President Donald Trump has boasted that his most sweeping tariffs amount to powerful leverage to win trade concessions from Beijing to Brussels.
title: Court Setbacks on Tariffs Rob Trump of a Prized Asset: Leverage

author: Andrea Dudik
description: Czech Justice Minister Pavel Blazek resigned amid criticism that his ministry accepted a gift in Bitcoin from a convicted criminal and later sold the cryptocurrency for about 1 billion koruna ($45 million).
title: Czech Justice Minister Resigns Over $45 Million Gift in Bitcoin

author: Jim Wyss
description: Top Cuban officials took to the airwaves as a shortage of cooking gas on the communist-run island prompted an unusual spike in electricity demand that’s now exacerbating blackouts.
title: Cooking Gas Shortage in Cuba Fuels Electric Demand, Deepening Energy Crisis

author: Beril Akman, Firat Kozok
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan reiterated his opposition to interest rates while endorsing the country’s orthodox economic program, which relies on high borrowing costs to curb inflation.
title: Erdogan Backs Turkey Economy Plan But Repeats Distaste for Rates

author: Todd Woody, Ari Natter
description: How Republicans want to remake the Inflation Reduction Act.
title: Congress Could Unravel Biden’s Climate Law. Here’s What to Watch.

author: Allyson Versprille
description: The US Transportation Department said it’s pausing planned cuts to its workforce while it waits for resolution in pending legal battles over the Trump administration’s efforts to significantly reduce the size of the federal government.
title: US Transport Department Pauses Planned Workforce Cuts Due to Litigation

author: Greg Stohr
description: The Supreme Court let the Trump administration immediately strip the legal right to temporarily live and work in the US from as many as half a million people from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Strip 500,000 Migrants of Legal Status

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron urged China to prevent its ally North Korea from joining Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.
title: Macron Urges China to Stop North Korea From Deploying in Europe

author: Ari Natter
description: The Energy Department is canceling some $3.7 billion in government support for clean energy projects it said did not warrant continued backing from the Trump administration.
title: Trump Is Canceling $3.7 Billion in Clean Energy Projects

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: A spike in custom import duties shows proceeds from retaliatory tariffs are starting to roll into the coffers of Canada’s federal government.
title: Tariff Revenues Rise Sharply in Canada After Retaliation Against Trump Levies

author: Emily Flitter
description: After losing $60 million in federal funding, a pair of national housing groups made strategic edits to their websites — and got it back.
title: DOGE Funding Cuts Prove Fleeting for Groups That Ditch DEI Words

author: Tom Rees
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves nominated Richard Hughes to serve a second term as head of the Office for Budget Responsibility, Britain’s powerful fiscal watchdog.
title: Reeves Nominates UK OBR Chief Richard Hughes for Reappointment

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump accused China of violating an agreement with the US to ease tariffs, ratcheting up tensions between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Says China ‘Totally Violated’ Trade Agreement With US

author: Henry Meyer, Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Russia said it’s sending a delegation to Istanbul Monday for a second round of talks with Ukraine amid last-minute wrangling over Kyiv’s insistence that Moscow outline its peace proposals before any meeting.
title: Russia to Attend Fresh Talks as Ukraine Demands Peace Proposals

author: Gregory Korte
description: In a test of a 90-year-old court decision, Trump is attempting to rein in US agencies that oversee everything from securities to cigarette lighters.
title: What If Independent Regulators Are No Longer Independent?

description: The BBC has been ordered to pay former Sinn Fein leader Gerry Adams 100,000 (£84,000) after he won a "resounding" libel victory over the broadcaster.
title: BBC to Pay Gerry Adams 100,000 Euros in Defamation Case

author: Rick Clough
description: Elon Musk was using drugs more heavily than previously known while on the campaign trail to help elect Donald Trump president, worrying some people close to the mercurial billionaire, the New York Times reported.
title: Musk’s Drug Use on Campaign Trail Generated Concern, NYT Says

author: Enda Curran, Alicia Diaz
description: The court ruling that blocked much of President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs threatens to blow what some economists estimate as a $2 trillion hole into the US fiscal outlook over the coming decade, should the judgment stay in place.
title: Tariff Ruling Threatens a $2 Trillion Fiscal Hole in Trump Plan

author: Shruti Srivastava, Ruchi Bhatia
description: India will urge the US to drop all the tariffs imposed on April 2 as it adopts a tougher negotiating stance in the wake of legal challenges to President Donald Trump’s signature trade policy, people with knowledge of the matter said.
title: India Toughens Stance in US Trade Talks After Courts Weigh In

author: Arne Delfs
description: A junior member of German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s cabinet proposed a new tax on internet platforms like Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Meta Platforms Inc.’s Facebook, a move that could stoke further trade tensions with the US.
title: German Minister Eyes New Digital Tax as US Prepares Pushback

author: Andrew Rosati
description: In the tit-for-tat trade war between the US and China, Latin America is siding with Beijing.
title: In US-China Trade War, Latin America Takes Sides With Beijing

author: Martha Viotti Beck
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s disapproval rating rose in May as a burgeoning social security scandal helped turn corruption into Brazilians’ top concern.
title: Lula Disapproval Rises as Scandal Feeds Corruption Concerns

author: Ben Steverman
description: House Republicans’ “big, beautiful bill” could bring hundreds of billions of dollars in tax cuts to wealthy business owners.
title: Trump’s Tax Bill Has Nasty Surprise in SALT Fine Print for Some Rich Americans

author: Josh Xiao, Haslinda Amin
description: Canada reaffirmed its close military ties with the US and spoke in support of President Donald Trump’s proposed “Golden Dome” missile defense system, which Ottawa is thinking about joining.
title: Canada Defends Golden Dome, Reaffirms Military Ties With US

author: Tom Rees
description: UK officials are probing the legal and practical implications of forcing households to fill out key economic surveys after a collapse in responses left the Bank of England in the dark over jobs data crucial to its interest-rate decisions.
title: UK Probes Feasibility of Forcing Public to Complete Labor Survey

author: Taonga Mitimingi
description: Zambia plans to boost the number of elected members of parliament by more than a third, raising the prospect of a higher government wage bill at a time when the state is trying to conclude a debt-restructuring process.
title: Zambia Proposes Increased Number of Lawmakers as Elections Loom

author: Ben Westcott
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Albanese’s Australian Balancing Act Faces Greatest Test Yet

author: Ben Westcott
description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth urged Australia to increase its military spending, in the latest push from the Trump administration for its allies to shoulder a greater responsibility for their own protection.
title: US ‘Respectfully’ Urges Australia to Boost Its Defense Spending

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government’s move to crack down on migration is set to all but wipe out Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’s budgetary room for maneuver because of a lower tax take, according to analysis from Bloomberg Economics.
title: Labour’s Migration Crackdown Puts Reeves’ UK Headroom at Risk

author: Lucy White, William Selway
description: The chair of Reform UK dismissed concerns that its plans to cut taxes and increase welfare benefits would rattle the bond market, casting the moves as part of a broader plan to “modernize the economy and get it growing again.”
title: Reform UK Chair Dismisses Worries About Cost of Tax, Spend Plans

author: Colum Murphy, Haslinda Amin
description: One of Washington’s most vocal China critics defended the Trump administration’s plan to revoke visas for Chinese students and called for a reset in bilateral ties, citing national security concerns.
title: China Hawk Blames Beijing for Trump Visa Bans, Urges Reset

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s economy expanded less than projected in the first quarter despite a brief period of interest-rate cuts.
title: Turkey’s Economy Expands Less Than Projected in First Quarter

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India is engaging with manufacturers from at least three other countries for jointly making fighter jet engines, expanding its defense partnerships beyond the US as it seeks to close capability gaps amid rising regional tensions, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: India Explores Partners Beyond US to Build Fighter Jet Engines

author: Philip Heijmans, Josh Xiao, Clara Ferreira Marques
description: France and Singapore signed a wide-ranging deal to enhance nuclear power and clean energy cooperation during President Emmanuel Macron’s visit to the city-state.
title: France Inks Deal with Singapore as Macron Courts Southeast Asia

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump’s administration insists his tariffs are here to stay, one way or another.
title: Trump’s Tariff Options Slower, More Complex If Court Fight Fails

author: Dan Williams, Fares Alghoul
description: Israel has accepted a US ceasefire proposal for Gaza that Israeli officials familiar with the matter said would involve a 60-day pause in the fighting and restore UN-led aid distribution to the enclave.
title: Israel Accepts Gaza Deal Restoring UN Aid as Hamas Remains Wary

author: Natalia Ojewska, Maciej Martewicz
description: The runoff vote for president has become a referendum on Poland’s role in Europe, women’s rights and support for neighboring Ukraine.
title: Poland’s Tight Election Puts Europe on Alert for Another Jolt

author: John Harney
description: North Korea has become a crucial source of missiles, munitions and even soldiers for Russia’s war in Ukraine as the sanctions-defying alliance between the two countries intensifies, according to a report by 11 countries, including the US and Japan.
title: North Korea’s Surging Military Aid to Russia Detailed in Report

author: Jenni Marsh
description: President Donald Trump is planning to ramp up weapon sales to Taiwan to a level exceeding his first term, Reuters reported, citing two US officials familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Aims to Exceed First-Term Taiwan Arms Sales, Reuters Says

author: Filipe Pacheco, Amanda Wang, Francesca Maglione
description: The Trump administration’s move to revoke visas for Chinese students is upending Anqi Dong’s dream of a US education even before it starts.
title: Chinese Students Ditch US Plans as Trump Vows Crackdown on Visas

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump will hold a news conference at the White House alongside Elon Musk to mark the world’s richest man’s departure from his official role leading the administration’s effort to slash the size and scope of the federal government.
title: Trump Will Hold Press Conference With Musk as He Departs DOGE
